com.milk.uberchat.irc
Class IRCSystem

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseEntity
        |
        +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseSystem
              |
              +--com.milk.uberchat.irc.IRCSystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChatEntity, ChatSystem, Commandable, Editable
public class IRCSystem
extends BaseSystem

This is the IRC-specific ChatSystem. It tries to stick pretty closely to the spec (i.e., RFC-1459), but has a couple of bits to make it a little more forgiving of noncompliance.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1998-1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Method Detail

canonicalUserName

public java.lang.String canonicalUserName(java.lang.String orig)
Turn the given user name into its canonical form. For IRC, this makes sure the name is of proper form, and lower-cases and interns it.

Specified by:
canonicalUserName in interface ChatSystem
Specified by:
canonicalUserName in class BaseSystem
Parameters:
orig - the original name
Returns:
the canonical form

canonicalChannelName

public java.lang.String canonicalChannelName(java.lang.String orig)
Turn the given channel name into its canonical form. For IRC, this makes sure that the name is of proper form (starts with '#' or '&'), and lower-cases and interns it.

Specified by:
canonicalChannelName in interface ChatSystem
Specified by:
canonicalChannelName in class BaseSystem
Parameters:
orig - the original name
Returns:
the canonical form

systemConnect

protected void systemConnect()
BaseSystem calls this method when it actually wants a connection to happen. It will only call this if the system is not actually connected.

Specified by:
systemConnect in class BaseSystem

systemDisconnect

protected void systemDisconnect()
BaseSystem calls this method when it actually wants to disconnect the system. It will only call this if the system is actually connected. Our interactor will call this too, if the server tells it to disconnect.

Specified by:
systemDisconnect in class BaseSystem

void sendCtcp(java.lang.String dest,
              java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String text,
              boolean normal)
Send a CTCP command to the host system.

Parameters:
dest - the destination name
name - the command name
text - the command text
normal - normal (true) or notice (false)

commandTap

void commandTap(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String[] params,
                int[] codes,
                ReplyTap tap)
Send a command and tap the given reply codes, sending them to the given tap. When the tap returns true, then the tap is considered done. Alternatively, if the interactor decides the tap is done (because of an error or some other weirdness), then it sends a null to the tap and then stops sending anything else.

Parameters:
name - the command name
params - the parameters
codes - the reply codes to tap
tap - the object to send the replies to

rawSend

void rawSend(java.lang.String raw)
Do a raw send to the host system.

Parameters:
raw - the string to send

speakTo

void speakTo(ChatLocus locus,
             java.lang.String kind,
             java.lang.String text)
Handle all the details of speaking to a particular locus.

Parameters:
locus - the locus to speak to
kind - the speech kind, including ctcp types
text - the text to speak

callSystemDisconnected

void callSystemDisconnected()
Tell the system that it's now disconnected.

callBroadcast

void callBroadcast(BaseEvent ev)
Call BaseEntity.broadcast() on an event. This is defined to give this package access to an otherwise-protected method.

Parameters:
ev - the event to broadcast

dispatchBroadcast

void dispatchBroadcast(BaseEvent ev)
Cast the source of the given event and call the appropriate callBroadcast() method. This is how one can generically create and send out events without allowing the outside world to have the same power.

Parameters:
ev - the event to broadcast

doConnect

private void doConnect()
This method gets called in a thread when a systemConnect request gets made.

callSystemConnectedEtc

private void callSystemConnectedEtc()
Do all the final setup when we finally make a successful connection to a system.
